revised_title: Effects of High Initial Pressures and Temperatures on Detonation in Gaseous Mixtures
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on detonation in acetylene and pentane mixtures at high initial pressures and temperatures. They found that increasing the initial pressure significantly increased the tendency to detonate, but the limit was reached at about 3 atmospheres. The authors also observed the effects of temperature on detonation and the influence of "antiknocks" on detonation at high pressure.
